description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fj9kf","text":"The Roundjaw Bonefish (Albula glossodonta) genome assembly was annotated following the MAKER pipeline. The steps we took are outlined here, but this process assumes you have successfully installed MAKER in advance. The following versions of tools were used (in alphabetical order): AUGUSTUS v3.3.2, BEDTools v2.28.0, BUSCO v4.0.6 with OrthoDB v10, EVidenceModeler v1.1.1, GeneMark-ES v4.38, gFACs v1.1.1, InterProScan v5.45-80.0, MAKER v3.01.02-beta, NCBI BLAST+ Suite v2.9.0, SNAP commit #daf76ba (3 June 2019), and tRNAscan-SE v1.3.1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":23,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Genome Annotation,MAKER Annotation Pipeline,Albula glossodonta,Roundjaw Bonefish
manuscript_citation: Brandon D. Pickett, Sheena Talma, Jessica R. Glass, Daniel Ence, Timothy P. Johnson, Paul D. Cowley, Perry G. Ridge, John S. K. Kauwe. Genome Assembly of the Roundjaw Bonefish (Albula glossodonta), a Vulnerable Circumtropical Sportfish. GigaByte 2022. DOI: 10.46471/gigabyte.44.

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6jibq","text":"Prepare for MAKER","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"g6oe","text":"Create a working directory for MAKER and then create the initial control files. Edit them to match your environment using your favorite text editor, e.g., we had to set use_rapsearch to 0 and blast_type to ncbi+ in maker_bopts.ctl. Take a careful look at maker_exe.ctl to ensure you have the paths correctly set for the requisite executables. {"blocks":[{"key":"1mqt2","text":"GeneMark-ES","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ecs53","text":"Three ab initio gene prediction programs were run between MAKER rounds 1 and 2. AUGUSTUS and SNAP can take gene models as input, and they are thus able to be run with new models after rounds 1 and 2 of MAKER in preparation for rounds 2 and 3, respectively. GeneMark-ES does not take gene models as input, and it thus needs to be run only one time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5bgdm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6fsaq","text":"GeneMark-ES required a software key to be run, which can be obtained or re-obtained for free for academic use at any time.
